page.title: 01CASTLE CARY 1086
page.content: { {Castle Cary}was mentioned in the original{Domesday Book}of 1086.It was part of a barony held by Walter of Douai.There was land for 20 ploughs(a plough being enough land for a family to farm and support itself on).This amounted to about 2,000 acres being farmed.At that time 23 villagers and 20 small holders with 17 ploughs,7 hides and 3 mills were recorded.Land cover was said to be 100 acres meadow and woodland 1 league square. The name of{Castle Cary}appears to have derived from the building of a castle at the source of the River Cary.Today the site is hard to see and the source of the river is now a pond called Park Pond.
